Although most patients were diagnosed as having CVA16 or EV71 infections by the qRT-PCR analysis, some were negative for Enterovirus. To identify the pathogens responsible for Enterovirus-negative HFMD children, samples from each of the patients were subjected to EOPM analysis. The enrichment analysis at the species level identified Theiler's-like Cardiovirus as the most probable pathogen responsible for the HFMD infection in these patients ( Table 7) .
